Race.SpecificTitle: Broadmoor Neigh. Imprv. Dist. -- $100 Parcel Fee - CC - 5 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100) for a period not to exceed five (5) years on all property for the purpose of encouraging the beautification and overall benefit of the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual parcel fee to be called the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter streets and avenues:  beginning at the intersection of Nashville Avenue and South Claiborne Avenue proceeding along Nashville Avenue to its intersection with Fontainebleau Drive, along Fontainebleau Drive to its intersection with Octavia Street, along Octavia Street to its intersection with South Jefferson Davis Parkway, along South Jefferson Davis Parkway to its intersection with Washington Avenue, then along Washington Avenue to where it turns into Toledano Street and then along Toledano Street to its intersection with South Claiborne Avenue and back to the intersection of South Claiborne Avenue and Nashville Avenue, as specified by Resolution R-10-339 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100) annually, for a period not to exceed five (5) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2015, with an estimated $121,600 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively for promoting quality of life initiatives and encouraging the beautification and overall benefit in the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Broadmoor Neighborhood Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Kenilworth Imp. Dist. -- $200 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Kenilworth Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a parcel fee in an amount not to exceed two hundred ($200.00) dollars, for a period not to exceed eight (8) years, on all property in the Kenilworth Improvement District for promoting and encouraging security and overall betterment of the Kenilworth Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual parcel fee to be called the Kenilworth Improvement District Parcel Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Kenilworth Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter streets: the mid-line of Morrison Road on the south, New Castle Street on the west, including parcels on both sides of the street, Wales Street on the north, including parcels on both sides of the street that the municipal addresses on Wales Street and the mid-line of Mayo Road on the east; and, as specified by Resolution R-10-333 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) annually for a period not to exceed (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $140,000 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security and overall betterment in the Kenilworth Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Kenilworth Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Oaks Subdv. Imp. Dist. -- $400 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee renewal in the amount not to exceed four hundred dollars ($400) on all taxable real property, for a term not to exceed four (4) years, in the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District to promote and encourage security and overall betterment in the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee renewal to be called the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District Fee, on taxable real property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans, as specified by Resolution R-10-375 of the City Council of New Orleans, in the amount not to exceed four hundred dollars ($400) on all parcels of land located within Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District for a term not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $99,050 expected to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security and overall betterment in the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District, as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Oaks Subdivision Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lake Willow Subdiv. Imprv. Dist. -- $300 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300) for a period not to exceed (4) years on all property to promote and encourage the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual flat fee to be called the Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following boundaries: Morrison Road on the north, the Lawrence Drainage Canal on the west, the I-10 Service Road on the south, and on the east by a line approximately two hundred feet west of the west line of Crowder Road, excluding lots 1B, 1C, and 1D shown on the subdivision plan, which is registered in COB692, 8 folio 202, Orleans Parish, comprising all of the Lake Willow Subdivision, as specified by Resolution R-10-338 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300) annually, for a period not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $58,800 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the beautification, security and overall betterment in the Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lake Willow Subdivision Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lakeshore Crime Prevention District -- $360 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lakeshore Crime Prevention District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a parcel fee in an amount not to exceed three hundred sixty dollars ($360), for four (4) years, on all property in the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District to promote and encourage security in the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee to be called the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District, on property situated within the boundaries of the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans as specified by Resolution R-10-374 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed three hundred sixty dollars ($360) on all parcels of land located within Lakeshore Crime Prevention District, not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014 with an expected $236,520 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lakeshore Crime Prevention District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lakeview Crime Prevention Dist. -- $150 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lakeview Crime Prevention District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a parcel fee in the amount of not to exceed one hundred fifty dollars ($150) on all improved parcels, for four (4) years in the Lakeview Crime Prevention District to promote and encourage security in the Lakeview Crime Prevention District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee to be called the Lakeview Crime Prevention District Parcel Fee, on improved parcels situated within the boundaries of the Lakeview Crime Prevention District, which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter streets and avenues:  commencing at the corner of City Park Avenue and Orleans Avenue and proceeding in a westerly direction along City Park Avenue to the Pontchartrain Expressway, thence in a northerly direction to the intersection of Veterans Memorial Boulevard, thence in a westerly direction to the 17th Street Canal, thence in a northerly direction to Lake Pontchartrain, thence in an easterly direction to West End Boulevard, thence in a southerly direction to Robert E. Lee Boulevard, thence in an easterly direction to Orleans Avenue, and thence in a southerly direction to City Park Avenue and the point of beginning, as specified by Resolution R-10-331 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed one hundred fifty dollars ($150) on all improved parcels of land located within Lakeview Crime Prevention District for four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $917,514 expected annually from the levy to be collected from the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security in the Lakeview Crime Prevention District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lakeview Crime Prevention District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lakewood Crime Prev. & Imprv. Dist. -- $450 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  Renewal of a parcel fee in the amount not to exceed four hundred fifty dollars ($450) for eight years on all property, improved and unimproved, in the Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual parcel fee to be called the Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District, on property situated within the boundaries of the Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District which is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans as specified by Resolution R-10-332 of the City Council of New Orleans in the amount not to exceed four hundred fifty dollars ($450) on all parcels of land, improved and unimproved, located within Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District for eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $180,000 expected annually from the levy of the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to aid in crime prevention by providing security for District residents and to serve the needs of the residents of the District by funding beautification and other activities and improvements for the overall betterment in the Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Lakewood Crime Prevention and Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Lakewood East Sec. & Imprv. Dist. -- $300 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Lakewood East Security and Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300) for a period not to exceed (8) years on all property for promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Lakewood East Security and Improvement District.  The District will also encourage, promote, and advance the nonprofit interests of homeowners in the subdivision through participation in charitable activities and events.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee to be called the Lakewood East Security and Improvement District Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Lakewood East Security and Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following boundaries:  Interstate 10 Service Road, Mayo Boulevard, Orleans Parish School Property formerly known as the Livingston Middle School, and St. Charles Canal, as specified by Resolution R-10-373 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300) annually, for a period not to exceed eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $34,500 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the Lakewood East Subdivision.  The District will also encourage, promote, and advance the nonprofit interests of homeowners in the subdivision through participation in charitable activities and events?

Race.SpecificTitle: Milneburg Neighborhood Imp. Dist. -- $200 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Milneburg Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) for a period not to exceed four (4) years on each parcel for promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment for the Milneburg Neighborhood Improvement District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual flat fee, to be called the Milneburg Neighborhood Improvement District fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Milneburg Neighborhood Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues:  Mexico Street, Saint Roch Avenue, Elysian Fields Avenue, and Filmore Avenue, as specified by Resolution R-10-341 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) annually, for a period not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $104,000 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, for the primary object and purpose of promoting and encouraging the beautification, security, and overall betterment of the District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Milneburg Neighborhood Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Oak Island Neigh. Imprv. Dist. -- $500 Parcel Fee - CC - 4 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500) for a period not to exceed four (4) years on all property in the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District for promoting and encouraging the beautification and overall betterment of the District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy a parcel fee to be called the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter streets and avenues:  Michoud Boulevard, from Adventure Drive to Expedition Drive (both sides), to Explorer Avenue, to Voyageur Drive and Voyageur Court (both sides), to Horizon Drive (both sides) to Pierre Court (both sides).  Also, Michoud Boulevard, to West Cavelier Drive (both sides), to Trapper Court (both sides), to St. Marie Court (both sides) and N. Cavelier Drive (both sides), as specified by Resolution R-10-336 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500) annually, for a period not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $226,000 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage beautification, security and overall betterment in the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Oak Island Neighborhood Improvement District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SummaryText:
Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District Proposition

Summary:  A parcel fee in the amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) for a period not to exceed four (4) years on all property for promoting and encouraging the beautification, security and overall betterment of the Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual flat fee to be called the Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District, which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenues:  Filmore Avenue to Leon C. Simon Boulevard to St. Roch Avenue to Peoples Avenue, as specified by Resolution R-10-340 of the City Council of New Orleans, in an amount not to exceed two hundred dollars ($200) annually, for a period not to exceed four (4) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2014, with an estimated $279,200 expected annually to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage beautification, security and overall betterment in the Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Seabrook Neighborhood Improvement and Security District, which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?

Race.SpecificTitle: Upper Hurstville Sec. Dist. -- $650 Parcel Fee - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Upper Hurstville Security District Proposition

Summary:  A special parcel fee in an amount not to exceed six hundred fifty dollars ($650) for eight (8) years on all property in the Upper Hurstville Security District for promoting security and the overall betterment of the Upper Hurstville Security District.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans levy an annual parcel fee (except that no fee shall be imposed upon any parcel whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level pursuant to Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Constitution of Louisiana), to be called the Upper Hurstville Security District Fee, on property situated within the boundaries of the Upper Hurstville Security District (which District is comprised of that area of the City of New Orleans within and including the following perimeter street and avenue:  Exposition Boulevard to Prytania Street to Nashville Avenue to Magazine Street and back to Exposition Boulevard), as specified by Resolution R-10-396 of the City Council of New Orleans in an amount not to exceed six hundred fifty dollars ($650) annually for eight (8) years, beginning in 2011 and ending in 2018, with an estimated $213,400 annually expected to be collected from the levy of the special fee for the entire year, to be used solely and exclusively to promote and encourage security and overall betterment in the Upper Hurstville Security District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the Upper Hurstville Security District which additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?
